How to optimize the electrochemical performance of solutions in a device by analyzing the internal resistance components and ionic conductivity (σ) of different solution systems to enhance ionic conductance?

At 37.5°C, by measuring the internal resistance components of a solution containing 1.2 M Fe(ClO₄)₂/Fe(ClO₄)₃ and 0.1 M HCl, the high concentration of Fe²⁺/Fe³⁺ (1.2 M) provides a large number of charge carriers, and 0.1 M HCl further enhances ionic conductivity through H⁺ and Cl⁻ ions. ClO₄⁻, as a weakly coordinating anion, is expected not to significantly impede the redox reaction of Fe²⁺/Fe³⁺, thus maintaining efficient charge transfer.
